definitions.definition: The ability to hold, receive or absorb
A measure of such ability; volume
The maximum amount that can be held
definitions.example: It was hauling a capacity load.

definitions.definition: Capability; the ability to perform some task
The maximum that can be produced.
Mental ability; the power to learn
A faculty; the potential for growth and development
A role; the position in which one functions
Legal authority (to make an arrest for example)
(operations) The maximum that can be produced on a machine or in a facility or group.
definitions.example: Its capacity rating was 150 tons per hour, but its actual maximum capacity was 200 tons per hour.
There will be a capacity crowd at Busch stadium for the sixth game.
